summary: The data shows a total of 5 cases spread across different product areas including API, UI, Data Import, Authentication, and Performance. The priorities of the cases range from low to critical, with the majority being high and critical. The most common root causes are bugs and configuration issues. Most cases are either in the implementation or post-launch phase, and the majority of the cases are still open.

patterns.title: Equal Distribution of Product Areas
patterns.description: Each product area has exactly one case, indicating that issues are spread across the entire product rather than being concentrated in a specific area.

patterns.title: High Priority and Open Status
patterns.description: High and critical priority cases are prevalent, and the majority of cases are still open. This could indicate a slow response time or difficulty in resolving issues.

patterns.title: Common Root Causes
patterns.description: Bugs and configuration issues are the most common root causes, suggesting that these areas may need more attention in the product development process.

recommendations: Improve response time and resolution process for high and critical priority cases to enhance customer satisfaction.
Focus on reducing bugs and addressing configuration issues in the product development process to prevent such issues from occurring.
Provide more training or documentation on common issues like configuration to help users avoid these problems.
